start.question: Which procedure would you like to carry out?

options.label: I'm moving out of my parents' home

dem_1.question: What is your situation before moving?

dem_4.question: Do you have one or more children?

dem_step_1.step_title: Steps related to the home I'm leaving

options.label: I am a tenant
options.answer:
Before leaving my home:
- I must give notice to my landlord, respecting a notice period of 1 or 3 months.
- I must then carry out an inventory of fixtures with the landlord or their representative (real estate agent). On this occasion, I must give them my new address. If they refuse to do the inventory, I can contact a judicial officer.
I will get back the security deposit I paid within 1 or 2 months after I leave.
Note:
I must keep the paperwork related to this home for some time.

options.label: I am a homeowner
options.answer:
If I am a co-owner and I sell a unit in a condominium, I must inform the condominium manager of my new address and request a closing statement of charges.
Note: I must keep the paperwork related to this home for some time.

options.label: Yes
options.answer:
- If my children attend preschool or elementary school, I must ask for a school transfer or keep them in their current school.
- If my children are in middle or high school, a transfer may be needed. I can inquire about transportation assistance.
- Childcare arrangements outside school hours may need to be reorganized.
Note:
In the event of separation, I must inform the other parent and, if necessary, adjust custody and visitation rights.

If I hire a professional mover:

- The mover is responsible for any loss or damage during transport. I can ask for compensation.
- I can be compensated in case of delay.
- I can get a free quote.
- I can check if the mover is registered in the official transporters list.

If I do not hire a professional:

- I will not be compensated for any loss or damage during transport.
- I am liable for material damage (to the premises) or bodily injury.
- I can be prosecuted for using undeclared labor.

options.label: Yes
options.answer:
Whether I live alone or as a couple, I can contact my city hall or department to ask for help with moving (mover’s invoice, truck rental...) or installation costs (purchase of essential furniture...). This includes assistance from the Housing Solidarity Fund (FSL).

If I have at least 3 children (born or expected), I can request a moving allowance from the Caf or MSA to help with moving expenses. I must apply within 6 months after the move.

Reminder

As an employee, I check my collective agreement to see if my employer covers part or all of my moving expenses.

If I have just entered the State civil service (as a probationary or tenured officer), I may be eligible for the Installation Assistance for State Employees (AIP), under certain conditions.

options.label: No
options.answer:
Whether I live alone or as a couple, I can contact my city hall or department to ask for help with moving (mover’s invoice, truck rental...) or installation costs (purchase of essential furniture...). This includes assistance from the Housing Solidarity Fund (FSL).

Reminder:

As an employee, I check my collective agreement to see if my employer covers part or all of my moving expenses.

If I have just entered the State civil service (as a probationary or tenured officer), I may be eligible for the Installation Assistance for State Employees (AIP), under certain conditions.

options.label: Private sector employee
options.answer: I may be eligible for moving leave, if provided by my company’s collective agreement.

options.label: Public sector employee
options.answer: I may be eligible for special leave.

If I had home insurance for the place I'm leaving, I cancel it.

For my new home:

If I am a tenant, I must take out insurance covering rental risks. I can also purchase additional coverage for better protection.
If I am a roommate, the insurance requirements depend on the type of shared rental agreement.
If I am a homeowner, I can take out home insurance, but it’s not mandatory—unless my home is in a condominium, in which case insurance is required by the co-ownership regulations.

dem_step_7.step_title: Water, electricity, gas, phone, TV, internet

options.answer:
Electricity, gas
I must contact my electricity and gas suppliers to complete the necessary steps.
I can find available suppliers in my new city:
Find suppliers by ZIP code: https://comparateur-offres.energie-info.fr/calculette/process/suppliers-list?zipcode=

Water, phone, TV, internet
I must inform the companies managing my accounts or subscriptions, past and future: water services, telecom operators, TV, internet.
I should check the available internet access at my new place.
Note

If my current internet provider has no offers available at my new address, I can cancel my subscription without fees, for legitimate reason.
I can use La Poste's paid mail forwarding service: https://www.laposte.fr/demenagement-absence

options.label: Private sector employee
options.answer:
Single online declaration to CPAM, tax office, EDF, France Travail, Caf...

You can declare your address change online in a single operation to multiple organizations (CPAM, tax office, EDF, France Travail, Caf...):
Address change form: https://auth.service-public.fr/realms/service-public/protocol/openid-connect/auth?response_type=code&client_id=pslclient&scope=openid%20email%20particulier&state=balzS22bLtXcqK4vPbGsMCexPyi-qidsA0V0Dyz_uGc%3D&redirect_uri=https://demarches.service-public.fr/mademarche/JeChangeDeCoordonnees/openid

options.label: Yes
options.answer:
You must transfer or cancel your electricity, gas, water, and internet contracts for your old home and subscribe to new ones for the new home.
Check your providers' websites and compare offers before moving.

options.label: Yes
options.answer:
To ensure you don't miss important mail, you can set up a mail forwarding service via La Poste (the French postal service).
Link: https://www.laposte.fr/demenagement-absence

options.label: Yes
options.answer:
You must change the address on your car's registration within 1 month of moving.
You can do this online on the ANTS website: https://immatriculation.ants.gouv.fr

options.label: Yes
options.answer:
You can register on the electoral roll of your new municipality.
You can do this online via this link: https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/R16396

options.label: Yes
options.answer:
You must enroll your child in a school in your new town.
Contact the town hall or visit the official government website: https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/F1385

options.label: Yes, I already have a lease or a place to live
options.answer: Great, you're one step ahead! You can now focus on setting up your utilities and administrative changes.

options.label: No, I'm still looking for housing
options.answer:
No worries, here are some options to help you find housing:
- Student residences (CROUS)
- Private landlords (via leboncoin.fr, pap.fr, etc.)
- Social housing if you're eligible
- Word of mouth or social media groups

options.label: Yes, I'm a student or have a low income
options.answer:
You may be eligible for housing assistance such as APL (Aide Personnalisée au Logement) from the CAF.
You can run a simulation and apply online here: https://www.caf.fr/allocataires/mes-services-en-ligne/faire-une-simulation

options.label: No, I don't think I qualify
options.answer:
Even if you're unsure, it’s worth checking your eligibility for housing aid.
Simulation tool: https://www.caf.fr/allocataires/mes-services-en-ligne/faire-une-simulation

independance_2.question: What type of housing are you looking for?

independance_2bis.question: What type of housing are you looking for?

options.label: I am a public agent (civil servant or contractor)
Crous housing (social housing)
options.answer:
I can apply for student housing from Crous.

I need to use this online service:

My student services

This housing, located in university residences or other residences allocated to student housing, is granted under income conditions.

I am prioritized for obtaining this type of housing if I receive a social scholarship.

When I move into the housing, I will need to:

- Provide a security deposit. If necessary, I can apply for the Loca-pass advance (interest-free loan)
- Present a guarantor who agrees to pay the rent and charges if I am unable to do so. It can be a physical person (parent, friend...) or a legal entity (such as the Visale guarantee).

options.label: Private landlord housing
options.answer:
I can become a tenant:

- Either of an unfurnished rental property, with a residential lease
- Or of a furnished rental property, with a standard residential lease or a mobility lease (under certain conditions)

Note:

I can be the sole tenant of the property, rent it with others in a shared flat, or rent it for my couple (if I am married, in a civil partnership, or cohabiting).

To find the housing, I can:

- Check housing offers on Lokaviz
- Use a real estate agency, but I will have to pay fees for visiting, dossier, state of the premises...
- Use DossierFacile.fr to show the landlord the seriousness of my file

Before signing the lease, the landlord may require a guarantor. The guarantor is a person (parent, friend...) or a legal entity (such as Visale) who agrees to pay the rent and charges if I am unable to do so.

Additionally, I can:

- Apply for the Loca-pass advance (interest-free loan) to cover the deposit requested by the landlord when signing the lease
- Apply for housing solidarity fund (FSL) assistance to help finance my move-in costs.

When handing over the keys, I must conduct an inventory with the landlord or their representative (including a real estate agent).

options.label: Furnished room with a host
options.answer:
I can rent a furnished room with a host.

The room must be at least 9 m², have a window, be heated, and contain basic furniture (bedding, table, chair, storage, lighting).

If the room does not have a kitchenette or private sanitary facilities, it is mandatory to draw up a lease with an annex stating that the owner shares those with the tenant of the room.

In all cases, it is recommended to sign a standard rental lease for a furnished room or a mobility lease.

To find this type of housing, I can check rental listings on Lokaviz.

options.label: Social housing
options.answer:
I apply for social housing, which is granted under income conditions.

I can consult the Bienvéo website to know which social housing is available:

Online social housing application (and renewal)

If I am a government employee in Île-de-France, I also have access to the State Employee Housing Scholarship (BALAE), which lists available government housing.
I can also consider temporary housing solutions.
I can apply for the Loca-pass advance (interest-free loan) to cover the deposit requested by the landlord when signing the lease.

To make the application, I must use this online service:

Request a Loca-Pass advance

Note

I should not neglect the inventory. It is mandatory and must be conducted with the landlord when handing over the keys.

options.label: Private landlord housing
options.answer:
I can become a tenant:

- Either of an unfurnished rental property, with a residential lease
- Or of a furnished rental property, with a standard residential lease or a mobility lease (under certain conditions)

Note

I can be the sole tenant of the property, rent it with others in a shared flat, or rent it for my couple (if I am married, in a civil partnership, or cohabiting).

To find the housing, I can:

- Use a real estate agency. But I will have to pay fees for visiting, dossier, state of the premises...
- Use DossierFacile to show the landlord the seriousness of my file.

Before signing the lease, the landlord may require a guarantor who agrees to pay the rent and charges if I am unable to do so. It can be a physical person (parent, friend, ...) or a legal entity (example: Visale guarantee).

Additionally, I can:

- Apply for the Loca-pass advance (interest-free loan) to cover the deposit requested by the landlord when signing the lease.
- Apply for housing solidarity fund (FSL) assistance to help me move in.

When handing over the keys, I conduct an inventory with the landlord or their representative (including a real estate agent).

options.label: Other
options.answer:
When I hire a professional moving company, the mover is responsible in case of loss or damage to an item, and I can claim compensation.

Additionally, I can:

- Be compensated in case of delay
- Get a free quote
- Check if the mover is properly registered in the transport register

If I do not hire a professional:

- I have no recourse if my belongings are damaged or stolen
- I am responsible for any material damage (to the building) or bodily injury (to people)
- I may be prosecuted for illegal work (if applicable)

options.label: I am an employee
options.answer:
My municipality or department may offer financial aid for those who move (moving company bill, rental truck...), particularly through the Housing Solidarity Fund (FSL). It may also be for help with settling in (purchasing essential furniture...).

I check with my town hall.

As an employee, I may be eligible for moving assistance, under certain conditions.

options.label: Crous housing (social housing)
options.answer:
The cost of water and electricity consumption is included in the rent.
The internet connection is available in the room and possibly in a shared area of the residence. Its cost is included in the rent.

options.label: Landlord's housing
options.answer:
I subscribe to an offer with a telephone, television, and internet provider. The cost of these electronic communications is at my expense.
I must pay for water, gas, and electricity consumption, which are part of the rental charges.
Note:

Any necessary repairs are my responsibility for the duration of the rental.

options.label: Furnished room with a host
options.answer:
Most of the time, the landlord does not ask the student to pay for the internet connection.

However, they charge a flat rate for electricity, gas, and water. This flat rate must be mentioned in the rental contract.

options.label: Other
options.answer:
I subscribe to an offer with a telephone, television, and internet provider. The cost of these electronic communications is at my expense.
I must pay for water, gas, and electricity consumption, which are part of the rental charges.
Note:

Any necessary repairs are my responsibility for the duration of the rental.

options.label: Crous housing (social housing)
options.answer:
I can apply for housing assistance from Caf.

To apply, I use this online service:

Request for housing allowance online

To find out if I am eligible for these benefits and how much I can receive, I use this simulator:

Caf: estimate eligibility for housing allowances and calculate the amount

Note:

If I am in an apprenticeship contract with a private agricultural company, I may be eligible for Agri-Mobili-Jeune assistance in some cases. I can check my eligibility and apply using an online service.

If I am in an apprenticeship contract with another private company, I may also be eligible for Mobili-Jeune assistance in some cases. I can check my eligibility and apply using an online service.

options.label: Landlord's housing
options.answer:
I may be eligible for housing assistance from Caf under certain conditions.

To apply, I use this online service:

Request for housing allowance online

To find out if I am eligible for these benefits and how much I can receive, I use this simulator:

Caf: estimate eligibility for housing allowances and calculate the amount

Note:

If I am in an apprenticeship contract with a private agricultural company, I may be eligible for Agri-Mobili-Jeune assistance in some cases. I can check my eligibility and apply using an online service.

If I am in an apprenticeship contract with another private company, I may also be eligible for Mobili-Jeune assistance in some cases. I can check my eligibility and apply using an online service.

options.label: Furnished room with a host
options.answer:
I can apply for housing assistance from Caf provided I have signed a lease.

To apply, I use this online service:

Request for housing allowance online

To find out if I am eligible for these benefits and how much I can receive, I use this simulator:

Caf: estimate eligibility for housing allowances and calculate the amount

Note:

If I am in an apprenticeship contract with a private agricultural company, I may be eligible for Agri-Mobili-Jeune assistance in some cases. I can check my eligibility and apply using an online service.

If I am in an apprenticeship contract with another private company, I may also be eligible for Mobili-Jeune assistance in some cases. I can check my eligibility and apply using an online service.

options.label: Other
options.answer:
I may be eligible for housing assistance from Caf under certain conditions.
I need to apply using this online service:
Request for housing allowance online
To find out if I am eligible for these benefits and how much I can receive, I use this simulator:
Caf: estimate eligibility for housing allowances and calculate the amount

If I am a tenant, I must sign an insurance contract covering rental risks. I can also subscribe to additional coverage for better protection in case of damage. However, if I rent a furnished room with a host, and the landlord has already signed comprehensive insurance, I am not required to take out insurance.
If I am a roommate, the insurance subscription rules depend on the type of shared accommodation (with one or multiple rental contracts).

options.label: Other
options.answer: As a tenant, I must take out insurance for the rented accommodation.

options.label: I am a student (including apprentice/alternating)
options.answer:
I must inform my school of my change of address.

I can forward my mail to my new address using the service provided by La Poste:

Forward my mail in case of a move

options.label: Other
options.answer:
I can forward my mail to my new address using the service provided by La Poste:

Forward my mail in case of a move

options.label: I am a student (including apprentice/alternating)
options.answer:
After registering for citizen service at the age of 16, I must participate in a JDC.
If I want to do my JDC near my new address, I must declare it to my national service center.
Note
Until my 25th birthday, I must inform my national service center of any changes in my situation (family, professional, relocation).
I will look into the subsidies available to me: https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/F34964

options.label: I am a student (including apprentice/alternating)
options.answer: If I am renting a property from a private landlord, I must pay a waste removal tax or fee in certain municipalities.

options.label: Other
options.answer:
In some municipalities, I must pay a waste removal tax or fee to fund the collection of household waste.
Reminder
From the age of 18, if I am not included in my parents' tax household, I must file an income tax return.

options.label: I am a student (including apprentice/alternating)
options.answer:
I can choose a new treating physician because their office is located near my new address, for example.
I will check the rules regarding student affiliation to social security.

options.label: Other
options.answer: I can choose a new treating physician because their office is located near my new address, for example.

options.label: I am French
options.answer:
If I leave my parents' home permanently, I must:

- Declare my change of address to various organizations and companies. I can declare my change of address online in a single operation to La Poste, France Travail (formerly Pôle emploi), the tax office, etc.
- Update my situation with the companies managing my contracts and subscriptions (bank, phone subscription, auto insurance, etc.)
- Register my new address on the vehicle registration certificate (car registration). There is no need to change the address on my driver's license; I can do it when requesting a new license (in case of loss, theft, new category, etc.)
- Modify my identity papers and voter card, depending on my nationality:
  Answer the successive questions and the responses will display automatically
  I am French

Modify

If I am an adult, I must register on the electoral lists of my new municipality (or the new district in Paris, Lyon, and Marseille).

Note

If I don't have time to make this change and am still registered in my old municipality, I can vote there, for example, by giving a proxy before the election day or by going to my voting station on election day.

If I am over 16 and under 25, I must inform my national service center of my change of address.

Note

I am not required to request a change of the address on my identity card and passport.

options.label: I am European
options.answer:
If I leave my parents' home permanently, I must:

- Declare my change of address to various organizations and companies. I can declare my change of address online in a single operation to La Poste, France Travail (formerly Pôle emploi), the tax office, etc.
- Update my situation with the companies managing my contracts and subscriptions (bank, phone subscription, auto insurance, etc.)
- Register my new address on the vehicle registration certificate (car registration). There is no need to change the address on my driver's license; I can do it when requesting a new license (in case of loss, theft, new category, etc.)
- Modify my identity papers and voter card, depending on my nationality:
  Answer the successive questions and the responses will display automatically
  I am European

Modify

If I am a citizen of another EU member state:

- I can register on the electoral lists of my new municipality to participate in municipal and/or European 2024 elections (to elect French representatives to the European Parliament)
- If I have an EU residence card (not mandatory), I must have it modified.

options.label: Other situation
options.answer:
If I leave my parents' home permanently, I must:

- Declare my change of address to various organizations and companies. I can declare my change of address online in a single operation to La Poste, France Travail (formerly Pôle emploi), the tax office, etc.
- Update my situation with the companies managing my contracts and subscriptions (bank, phone subscription, auto insurance, etc.)
- Register my new address on the vehicle registration certificate (car registration). There is no need to change the address on my driver's license; I can do it when requesting a new license (in case of loss, theft, new category, etc.)
- Modify my identity papers and voter card, depending on my nationality:
  Answer the successive questions and the responses will display automatically
  Other situation

Modify

I must have my residence permit modified.

options.label: I am looking for my first job
I have already worked (with an employment contract)

emploi_step_1.step_title: I am registering with France Travail

options.label: I am looking for my first job
options.answer:
I register with France Travail as a job seeker.
I go to my appointment with my France Travail agency for personalized support and to complete my personalized employment access plan (PPAE).
Note

I am required to update my status online, by phone, or in person at my France Travail agency to confirm I am still looking for a job.
Failure to do so may result in being removed from the job seeker list.

options.label: I have already worked (with an employment contract)
options.answer:
I register with France Travail as a job seeker.
I go to my appointment with my France Travail agency for personalized support and to complete my personalized employment access plan (PPAE).
I need to update my status to confirm I am still looking for a job. Failure to do so may result in removal from the job seeker list.
Note

For some employees affected by an economic layoff procedure, France Travail support may be included in a professional security contract (CSP).

emploi_step_2.step_title: I am looking for a job

options.label: I am looking for my first job
options.answer:
I use 'la bonne boîte' to find companies hiring without posting job offers: https://labonneboite.francetravail.fr/
- I check job offers on the France Travail website (https://candidat.francetravail.fr/offres/emploi) and manage my applications with Memo (from France Travail)
- I check job offers on the Centre d'information et de documentation jeunesse (CIDJ) website
- I check the Association for Executive Employment (Apec) website: https://www.apec.fr/candidat.html
- I check the site Choose the public service: https://choisirleservicepublic.gouv.fr/
- I learn about the possibility of searching for a fixed-term contract (CDD) or using temporary work: https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/F32476
- I request to sign an integration contract, depending on my situation (youth, senior, etc.)
- I expand my job search to other countries in the European Union or the rest of the world

options.label: I have already worked (with an employment contract)
options.answer:
I use 'la bonne boîte' to find companies hiring without posting job offers: https://labonneboite.francetravail.fr/
- I check job offers on the France Travail website (https://candidat.francetravail.fr/offres/emploi) and manage my applications with Memo (from France Travail)
- I check the Association for Executive Employment (Apec) website: https://www.apec.fr/candidat.html
- I check the site Choose the public service: https://choisirleservicepublic.gouv.fr/
- I learn about the possibility of searching for a fixed-term contract (CDD) or using temporary work: https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/F32476
- I request to sign an integration contract, depending on my situation (youth, senior, etc.)
- I expand my job search to other countries in the European Union or the rest of the world

To know

If I am in a layoff notice period, the employer may allow me to take a few hours off to search for a job.

emploi_step_3.step_title: I can benefit from financial aid

options.label: I am looking for my first job
options.answer:
Registering with France Travail allows me to find out about available financial aid.
I learn about other aids I may be entitled to:
- Active solidarity income (RSA), under certain conditions
- Mobility aid (including transport vouchers and SNCF booking vouchers)
- Driver's license aid
- Specific solidarity allowance (ASS), under certain conditions
- Business start-up or recovery aid (Arce), under certain conditions
- Childcare aid, under certain conditions

options.label: I have already worked (with an employment contract)
options.answer:
Registering with France Travail allows me to apply for unemployment benefits (ARE). This unemployment benefit is granted under certain conditions (including in the case of resignation).
A simulator is available to estimate your unemployment benefit rights: https://candidat.francetravail.fr/portail-simulateurs/
Registering with France Travail also allows me to find out about available financial aid.
I learn about other aids I may be entitled to:
- Active solidarity income (RSA), under certain conditions
- Mobility aid (including transport vouchers and SNCF booking vouchers)
- Driver's license aid
- Specific solidarity allowance (ASS), under certain conditions
- Business start-up or recovery aid (Arce), under certain conditions
- Childcare aid for single parents (Agepi), under certain conditions
After my income reduction:
- I may, in some cases, receive the activity bonus
- If I am a tenant of social housing, I must inform my landlord about the change in my situation. I may be eligible for a reduction in my solidarity rent supplement (SLS), if I pay it.

options.label: I am looking for my first job
options.answer:
- I can ask France Travail for a skills assessment
- I can search for training on the France Travail website (https://candidat.francetravail.fr/formations/recherche) and the Centre for the Development of Training Information (Centre Inffo: https://www.orientation-pour-tous.fr/)
- I can also engage in a voluntary mission, which is training and compensated

options.label: I have already worked (with an employment contract)
options.answer:
- I request a skills assessment from France Travail
- I search for training on the France Travail website (https://candidat.francetravail.fr/formations/recherche) and the Centre for the Development of Training Information (Centre Inffo: https://www.orientation-pour-tous.fr/)
- I can also engage in a voluntary mission, which is training and compensated
- I can request a recognition of prior learning (VAE)

options.label: I am looking for my first job
options.answer:
I need to notify the change in my situation to:

- My France Travail agency
- My family allowance fund
- My national service center if I am under 25

options.label: I have already worked (with an employment contract)
options.answer:
I need to notify the change in my situation to:

- My France Travail agency
- My family allowance fund
- My national service center if I am under 25
- My insurer or my bank (in case of insurance against job loss)

emploi_step_6.step_title: I can benefit from financial aid related to my job

options.answer: Under certain conditions, I may be eligible for the activity bonus: https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/N31477
